Refer to figure.

If the altitude is increased and the TAS remains constant in the troposphere under standard atmospheric conditions, the Mach number will

options.text: increase or decrease, depending on the type of aeroplane.

variant.question: In a high speed descent at MMO you will reach VMO at

An aircraft is flying straight and level. What can be said to remain constant if the speed indicated in the Airspeed Indicator does not change? Assume there are no mechanical malfunctions or environmental errors affecting the indicator:
During a descent at a constant Mach number (assume zero thrust and standard atmospheric conditions):

options.text: the angle of attack will decrease.

variant.question: During a descent at a constant Mach number (assume zero thrust and standard atmospheric conditions):

options.text: the angle of attack will increase.

variant.question: A commercial jet aeroplane is performing a straight descent at a constant Mach number with constant mass. The operational speed limit that may be exceeded is
Assuming ISA conditions and a descent above the tropopause at constant Mach number and aeroplane mass, the:
Assuming ISA conditions and a descent above the tropopause at constant Mach number and aeroplane mass, the:
Assuming ISA conditions and a descent below the tropopause at constant Mach number and aeroplane mass, the:
Assuming ISA conditions and a descent below the tropopause at constant Mach number and aeroplane mass, the:
How does the Mach number change during a climb at constant IAS from sea level to 40 000 ft?

options.text: Initially remains constant until approximately 25 000 ft and then increases with increasing altitude.
Initially remains constant until approximately 25 000 ft and then decreases with increasing altitude.

variant.question: During a climb at a constant IAS, the Mach number will

options.text: increase initially and remain constant subsequently.

variant.question: What needs to be considered when descending at MMO/VMO?

options.text: Aerodynamic limitations at high altitude and structural limitations at low altitude.
Structural limitations at high altitude and structural limitations at low altitude.
Aerodynamic limitations at high altitude and aerodynamic limitations at low altitude.
Structural limitations at high altitude and aerodynamic limitations at low altitude.

variant.question: Assuming ISA conditions and a descent below the tropopause at constant Mach number and aeroplane mass, the..
Assuming ISA conditions and a descent above the tropopause at constant Mach number and aeroplane mass, the..
An aircraft is climbing at a constant IAS close to V~MO~ above FL230. What could the flight crew do to avoid accidentally exceeding M~MO~? The flight crew must..

options.text: stop flying at a constant IAS and fly at a constant Mach number.
accelerate past V~MO~ to avoid exceeding M~MO~.
stop flying at a constant IAS and fly at a constant TAS.
decelerate past V~S0~ to avoid exceeding M~MO~.

variant.question:
Maintaining a constant Flight Level and IAS, an aircraft flies into a colder airmass. 
 Choose the correct statement:

options.text: Mach number decreases, There is a risk of a low speed warning.
Mach number increases. There is a risk of a high speed warning.
Mach number stays the same, but there is an increased risk of high speed buffet and a shock stall.

variant.question: An aircraft is descending at a constant Mach number and a constant weight. Which of the following operational speed limitations may likely be exceeded?
What needs to be considered when descending at M~MO~/V~MO~?

options.text: Aerodynamic limitations at high altitude and structural limitations at low altitude.
Structural limitations at high altitude and aerodynamic limitations at low altitude.
Aerodynamic limitations at high altitude and aerodynamic limitations at low altitude.
Structural limitations at high altitude and structural limitations at low altitude.

variant.question: Assuming ISA conditions, climbing at a constant Mach number up to tropopause the TAS will:
You are above the tropopause and descending to FL 340 at a constant Mach speed, which statement is true?

options.text: Coefficient of lift remains the same

variant.question: An aircraft is descending from FL290 at a constant Mach number close to MMO. What must the flight crew do to avoid accidentally exceeding VMO?

options.text: At the changeover altitude the flight crew must stop flying at a Mach number and fly at a constant IAS.
At the transition level the flight crew must stop flying at a Mach number and fly at a constant IAS.
At the transition level the flight crew must stop flying at a Mach number and fly at an increased IAS.
At the changeover altitude the flight crew must stop flying at a Mach number and fly at an increased IAS.

variant.question: An aeroplane is flying in the transonic speed range in straight and level flight. If the Mach number decreases, what additional input or action will be required to maintain straight and level flight to compensate for the centre of pressureâ€™s movement, whilst exiting the transonic region?

options.text: A pitch down input to the elevator or the stabiliser.
A lower IAS to compensate the nose up effect.
A pitch up input to the elevator or the stabiliser.

variant.question: Compare Maximum Operating Mach number (M~MO~) with Maximum Operational Speed (V~MO~). If a pilot wants to fly as fast as possible - e.g. for reaching the destination in time - what are the limitations if the descent will be initiated from a high cruising level?

options.text: At first the airplane is limited by its MMO, thereafter - below a certain altitude - by its VMO.
At first the airplane is limited by its VMO, thereafter - below a certain altitude - by its MMO.

variant.question: For a constant flight level and IAS, if the OAT increases, the Mach number will:
Assuming ISA conditions and a climb below the tropopause at constant Mach number:

options.text: It is not possible to climb at constant Mach number just below the tropopause.

variant.question: Above tropopause, an aircraft is descending from FL300 at a constant mach. Which of the following is correct?
An aircraft is flying at a constant Mach number and constant angle of attack. After the aircraft experienced wind shear, the low speed buffet margin...

options.text: is not influenced by the load factor.

variant.question: An aircraft is climbing close to the aerodynamic ceiling when it experiences windshear that increases the AoA. What would happen to the risk of low speed Mach buffet?
You are climbing to your aerodynamic ceiling in a busy class bravo airspace and you experience windshear that increases the AOA, what will happen to your low speed mach buffet?
An aircraft is cruising at FL 380 in turbulent conditions when there is a sudden updraft. It experiences no noticeable change in airspeed. Which statement is true?

options.text: Angle of attack increases; drag increases
Angle of attack increases; drag decreases
Angle of attack decreases; drag decreases
Angle of attack decreases; drag increases

variant.question:
VMCA is the minimum speed at which directional control can be maintained when, amongst others
1:maximum take-off thrust was set and is maintained on the remaining engines  
2:a sudden engine failure occurs on the most critical engine  
3:flaps are in any position  
4:the gear is either up or down  
5:the aeroplane is either in or out of ground effect
 The combination that regroups all of the correct statements is

Which of the following statements is correct? 
I When the critical engine fails during take-off the speed VMCL can be limiting
II The speed VMCL can be limited by the available maximum roll rate.

options.text: I is incorrect, II is correct.
I is correct, II is correct.
I is incorrect, II is incorrect.
I is correct, II is incorrect.

variant.question:
Which of the following statements is correct?
I When the critical engine fails during take-off the speed VMCL can be limiting
II The speed VMCL can be limited by the available maximum roll rate.

options.text: I is incorrect, II is correct.
I is incorrect, II is incorrect.
I is correct, II is incorrect.
I is correct, II is correct.

options.text:
When thrust available is equal to thrust
required

You have the maximum thrust available over thrust
required
